title: Ley Lines Of The Midwest
summary:
Key ideas
- Examining maps of the Midwest looking for consistent patterns
- Trying to find an underlying coordinate grid system
- Discussion of the Public Land Survey System and the quadrangle grid system
- Speculation about ley lines and coincidences in location of cities
- Mention of Zilwaukee, Michigan's origins and a related metaphor for the devil

Key learnings 
- The Midwest does not have a consistent underlying coordinate grid system for towns/cities
- Any perceived patterns in location of towns/cities are mostly coincidences
- There is a historical context behind the naming of some towns/cities in the Midwest

Key questions
- Can a consistent underlying coordinate grid system be found for any part of the US?
- Is there any significance to the location of cities/towns along particular lines or patterns?
- What are some other interesting historical tidbits about the Midwest?
